    • Method Detail

      • applyTo

        public State applyTo(State fromState,
                     java.lang.Character symbol)
        Returns the next state that this machine moves to.

        Returns the state that this machine move to, when it is currently in fromState and reads symbol from its input.

        Parameters:
        fromState - the current state
        symbol - the input symbol
        Returns:
        the next state

      • maps

        public boolean maps(State fromState,
                    java.lang.Character symbol)
        Check if a transition exists.

        Returns true if and only if there is a transition from fromState on symbol.

        Parameters:
        fromState - a state
        symbol - an input symbol
        Returns:
        true if and only if there is a transition

      • transitions

        public java.util.Set<Transition> transitions()
        Returns:
        the set of transitions of this function

      • prettyPrint

        Prints a humanly readable description of this transition function.
        Parameters:
        out - the print stream on which to print the description.

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode()
        Returns:
        a string encoding of this transition function

      • verifyTransitionMapping

        public void verifyTransitionMapping(java.util.Set<State> states,
                                    Alphabet alphabet)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks that the transition function contains valid states and symbols.
        Parameters:
        states - the states of the state machine that holds this mapping
        alphabet - the alphabet of the state machine that holds this mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if it finds a transition with a state that does not belong to the machine or a symbol that does not belong to the machine's alphabet.

      • veryifyTotal

        public void veryifyTotal(java.util.Set<State> states,
                         Alphabet alphabet)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks that the transition function is total.
        Parameters:
        states - all the states of the DFSM
        alphabet - the alphabet of the DFSM
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a state that does not have a transition on all the symbols in the machine's alphabet.

      • verifyNoEpsilonTransitions

        public void verifyNoEpsilonTransitions()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks that the transition function has no epsilon transitions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is an epsilon transition in the function
